entries.title: Florida school district to require students to use restrooms based on biological sex: reports
entries.description: A Florida school district, after nearly five years of not taking action, will implement rules requiring students to use the bathroom associated with their biological sex.

entries.title: Biden stumps Twitter users over 'neighborhood phrase': What the hell did he say?
entries.description: President Biden bewildered social media users after repeating an alleged phrase from his “old neighborhood” during his visit to Kentucky on Wednesday.

entries.title: Saquon Barkley says it's 'tough' to prepare for upcoming game following Damar Hamlin's collapse
entries.description: After Monday's Bills-Bengals game was postponed due to Damar Hamlin's cardiac arrest, Saquon Barkley admitted it's difficult to get ready for this week's game.

entries.title: Red Sox, Rafael Devers agree to massive extension: reports
entries.description: The Boston Red Sox have finally landed Rafael Devers now and for the future, reportedly agreeing to terms on an 11-year deal that will pay him $331 million to be their franchise star.

entries.title: Twitter eviscerates doomsday biologist who claims he’s been mostly right: ‘Famously wrong,’ ‘doom-monger'
entries.description: Journalists on Twitter mocked celebrity biologist Paul Ehrlich, who incorrectly predicted billions dead by starvation, for his claim to have made "no basic" errors.

entries.title: Marc Thiessen slams anti-McCarthy GOP faction, warns behavior spells 'big trouble' for Republicans
entries.description: Fox News contributor Marc Thiessen weighs what impact the anti-McCarthy faction and Trump's influence will have on GOP success in the 118th Congress.

entries.title: Massachusetts authorities seize 13,900 fentanyl pills, 30 pounds of cocaine in massive drug bust
entries.description: About 13,900 fentanyl pills, 30 pounds of cocaine, 406 grams of raw fentanyl were seized from a home after a lengthy investigation in Springfield, Massachusetts.

entries.title: Billie Eilish recalls hating her body as a teen and overcoming her painful diagnosis
entries.description: Billie Eilish discussed hating her body due to the pain it was causing her and how a correct medical diagnosis helped her realize that her body wasn't out to get her.

entries.title: Seven-time PGA Tour winner Jon Rahm anticipates 'tense' Masters Champions Dinner amid LIV Golf dispute
entries.description: Following last month's news that LIV golfers would be eligible to compete at the 2023 Masters, Jon Rahm said he foresees heightened tensions at the Champions Dinner.

entries.title: Mayorkas says massive migrant numbers 'straining our system,' calls for Congress to act
entries.description: DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas is warning that the numbers being encountered at the border are already straining the resources of Customs and Border Protection.

entries.title: Michelle Williams shares why she hasn't watched any of her movies or TV projects in over a decade
entries.description: "The Fabelmans" star Michelle Williams admitted that she hasn't watched her own films or TV projects since viewing 2010's "Meek's Cutoff." She said that she is "not able" to watch her own work.

entries.title: Tokyo to give 5,000 yen in monthly benefits per child
entries.description: The Tokyo Government is planning on offering households with children aged 18 or younger in the capital a monthly handout of about 5,000 yen, or 38 dollars, per child.

entries.title: Giants' Kayvon Thibodeaux dismisses Jeff Saturday's criticism of celebration: 'I don't know who he is'
entries.description: Kayvon Thibodeaux defended his celebration next to an injured Nick Foles on Sunday and said Jeff Saturday's criticism doesn't matter because Thibodeaux doesn't know who he is.

entries.title: Liberals cackle over Republican stalemate in House Speaker vote: ‘This is so great to witness’
entries.description: Liberals on Twitter shared how much they were enjoying the chaos surrounding Kevin McCarthy's, R-Calif., failed attempts to be elected as Speaker of the House.

entries.title: Tailgating not allowed at SoFi Stadium for Georgia-TCU national championship game
entries.description: Tailgating won't be allowed at SoFi Stadium on Monday leading into the national championship game between the TCU Horned Frogs and Georgia Bulldogs.

entries.title: GOP rep says McCarthy may need to step aside, suggests alcohol could help party reach consensus
entries.description: Ken Buck, R-Colo., said Kevin McCarthy may need to step aside if no deal can be reached to get him elected House speaker.

entries.title: Former Ohio lawmaker ignites Twitter debate over jobs, need for 'side hustles': 'Does that mean I'm poor?'
entries.description: Former Ohio lawmaker and progressive activist Nina Turner divides Twitter after writing that "side hustles" shouldn't need to exist and that one job should be enough.

entries.title: Biden doesn't believe NFL is getting too dangerous: 'Don't know how you avoid it'
entries.description: President Biden was asked if the NFL was getting too dangerous after Damar Hamlin suffered a cardiac arrest on "Monday Night Football." "It is dangerous," he said.

entries.title: Gabrielle Union confesses she ‘felt entitled’ to cheat in first marriage with Chris Howard: 'Dysfunctional'
entries.description: "10 Things I Hate About You" actor Gabrielle Union admitted she "felt entitled" to infidelity during her "dysfunctional" marriage with ex-husband Chris Howard.

entries.title: Texas sees rise in food truck thefts in state capital and surrounding area
entries.description: Multiple food trucks have been stolen in the Texas state capital of Austin and the surrounding area in recent months, according to police.

entries.title: NC State broadcaster Gary Hahn set to return to the booth after 'illegal aliens' remark
entries.description: NC State broadcaster Gary Hahn is set to return to the booth for Learfield Communications after making a reference to "illegal aliens" during a broadcast.

entries.title: Idaho murders suspect Bryan Kohberger's dad mentioned WSU SWAT shooting in new police bodycam
entries.description: Idaho murders suspect Bryan Kohberger and his father mentioned a Washington State University shooting during an Indiana traffic stop a month after the slayings.

entries.title: House adjourns without electing a speaker after McCarthy loses sixth ballot
entries.description: The House adjourned Wednesday until 8:00 p.m. ET after it failed for a sixth time to elect a speaker, as support for House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy declined.

entries.title: James Corden almost played Brendan Fraser's role in 'The Whale': report
entries.description: Before Brendan Fraser stepped into the critically acclaimed lead role in "The Whale," James Corden almost played the part, he said, according to a columnist.

entries.title: New Jersey police release dramatic video of stolen car going over guardrail and crashing on house, car
entries.description: New Jersey police released video of a car going over a guardrail and crashing into a home on Sunday, and said that no one was injured during the incident.

entries.title: Respect for Muslim students 'should have superseded academic freedom' in class controversy: College president
entries.description: A liberal arts college president in Minnesota issued an apology for offending Muslim students after they were shown depictions of the Prophet Muhammad in class.

entries.title: NFL exec again refutes report players were given 5 minutes to warm up after Damar Hamlin incident
entries.description: NFL EVP of football operations Troy Vincent doubled down on his slamming of the notion Bills and Bengals players were given five minutes to warm up after the Damar Hamlin incident.

entries.title: Former Carl’s Jr. model Charlotte McKinney unveils toned physique during ‘much needed reset in paradise’
entries.description: Charlotte McKinney, an Instagram model and Guess Girl, skyrocketed to fame in 2015 when she starred in a Carl’s Jr. commercial that aired during Super Bowl XLIX.

entries.title: ESPN pundit floats idea of pushing back NFL playoffs one week to complete Bills-Bengals game
entries.description: ESPN pundit Stephen A. Smith floated the idea of pushing back the NFL playoffs one week to complete the game between the Buffalo Bills and the Cincinnati Bengals.

entries.title: FIFA president 'dismayed' by criticism, attempts to clarify photo: 'Pelé’s teammates asked to do a selfie'
entries.description: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has said he is dismayed by the amount of backlash he received for taking a selfie near Pelé's open coffin at the public wake.

entries.title: Novak Djokovic risks missing US tournaments over new COVID-19 travel restrictions
entries.description: Update travel restrictions in the U.S. for non-citizens could mean 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic will miss out on several tournaments in the upcoming year.

entries.title: Reporter's Notebook: Memories of performing for Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI
entries.description: Fox News' chief religion correspondent Lauren Green, who is covering the funeral Benedict XVI from the Vatican, reflects on her meeting the late pope emeritus.

entries.title: California college trustee apologizes after 'threatening' remarks about faculty who oppose equity initiatives
entries.description: A California college board of trustees member apologized after saying faculty who opposed antiracist measures needed to be taken to 'the slaughterhouse.'

entries.title: Putin operatives trying to turn Germans against Ukraine war: report
entries.description: Factions of far-right groups and pro-Putin operatives have reportedly combined forces in Germany to push Berlin to end its support for Ukraine's defense against Russia's invasion.

entries.title: Dave Bautista relieved after leaving 'silly' Marvel role: 'It wasn’t all pleasant'
entries.description: After nearly a decade acting in the "Guardians of the Galaxy" franchise, Dave Bautista said in a recent interview that he is relieved to depart the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

entries.title: Democrats continue handing votes to Jeffries, who has long history of denying elections
entries.description: Democrats are steadily voting for Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries, who has a vast history of denying the legitimacy of elections, to become the next House speaker.

entries.title: Tirzepatide drug fast-tracked for weight loss indication by FDA: What to know about it
entries.description: An injection drug known as tirzepatide, already approved by the FDA for treating Type 2 diabetes, is likely to gain approval for weight loss treatment this year. Here's what to know.

entries.title: Deleted Biden campaign ad slamming Buttigieg's lack of experience resurfaces amid multiple crises
entries.description: A 2020 Biden campaign ad ripping Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg for his lack of experience has resurfaced despite the video being deleted more than two years.

entries.title: California Democrat offers to back 'unity candidate' for House speaker as McCarthy stalls
entries.description: Rep.-elect Ami Bera, D-Calif., said he would support a "unity candidate" for House speaker as the election stalemate continued into the fifth round of voting Wednesday.

entries.title: Danica McKellar goes makeup free to celebrate turning 48, talks 'newfound faith' and secret to youth
entries.description: "The Wonder Years" actress Danica McKellar revealed a natural makeup-free look for her 48th birthday and shared her secrets to looking young.

entries.title: Sharon Osbourne 'suddenly' passed out for 20 minutes during recent medical emergency: 'Nobody knows why'
entries.description: Sharon Osbourne shared details of her medical emergency for the first time during an episode of U.K.'s "The Talk." The TV personality revealed she passed out for 20 minutes.

entries.title: Idaho murder suspect Bryan Kohberger wanted to be Army Ranger, yearbook reveals
entries.description: Bryan Christopher Kohberger wanted to be in an elite infantry force in the U.S. Army as a sophomore before pivoting to a career in academia, his high school yearbook reveals.

entries.title: Iran sentences two teens to death for waging 'enmity against God' in protest against regime
entries.description: Iran issued two death sentences to teenagers this week who were involved in the nationwide demonstrations and deemed to have waged "enmity against God."

entries.title: Hugh Jackman pleads that Ryan Reynolds' 'Spirited' song doesn't get nominated for an Oscar in humorous video
entries.description: Hugh Jackman shared a comedic video to his Instagram talking about why the song "Good Afternoon" from "Spirited" shouldn't be nominated for an Oscar. The song heavily features Reynolds.

entries.title: Rick Singer, 'Operation Varsity Blues' college admissions scandal mastermind, sentenced to 42 months in prison
entries.description: The man behind the Operation Varsity Blues college admissions scandal that rocked the U.S. after its exposure in 2019 has been sentenced after pleading guilty.

entries.title: Conservative civil war rages on Twitter as McCarthy fails to win Speaker vote
entries.description: Conservative Congressman, journalists and influencers are trading blows on Twitter as Kevin McCarthy failed a fourth vote to become the next House speaker.

entries.title: Biden says it's his 'intention' to visit US-Mexico border amid historic crisis
entries.description: President Biden said on Wednesday that he intends to visit the U.S. -Mexico border amid a record number of migrant crossings at the border.

entries.title: Vietnamese boy, 10, dead after falling into 115-foot concrete hole
entries.description: A Vietnamese boy trapped down a 115-foot concrete hole at a construction site since New Year's Eve was declared dead Wednesday, but the boy's body has not yet been recovered.

entries.title: US reopens visa, consular services at Cuban embassy for first time since 'Havana Syndrome' incidents
entries.description: The American embassy in Havana, Cuba, has reopened its visa and consular services Wednesday for the first time since a series of health incidents dubbed the "Havana Syndrome."

entries.title: Nelson Mandela's granddaughter defends Prince Harry, Meghan Markle's use of legend's quotes in new docuseries
entries.description: In a new interview, Nelson Mandela's granddaughter Ndileka defended Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's use of the political activist's quotes in the couple's latest docuseries.

entries.title: California sheriff’s office shows exactly why no driver should ignore road closed signs
entries.description: The Calaveras County Sheriff's Office in California recounted a handful of flood rescue missions they completed and told the public to not ignore road closed signs while driving.

entries.title: McCarthy on track to lose 5th vote for House speaker
entries.description: House GOP leader Kevin McCarthy again failed to secure the necessary 218 votes to be the next House speaker on Wednesday, splitting the vote between Rep.-elects Hakeem Jeffries and Byron Donalds.

entries.title: Republican who backed McCarthy votes ‘present’ in fourth round of voting for House speaker
entries.description: One of Kevin McCarthy's prior supporters in the House speaker's race voted "present" in the fourth round of voting on Wednesday, and said Republicans need to "stop wasting everyone's time."

entries.title: Speaker's race: Chip Roy gets standing ovation after noting historic nominations of 2 Black Americans
entries.description: Rep. Chip Roy of Texas drew a standing ovation for Reps. Byron Donalds and Hakeem Jeffries as two Black congressmen in the hunt to become speaker of the House.

entries.title: DA blasts Louisiana cop charged in crash that killed two teenage cheerleaders: 'Stop the damn pursuit'
entries.description: High school cheerleaders Maggie Dunn and Caroline Gill were killed on New Year's Eve after an officer in a high speed chase ran a red light and crashed into their vehicle.

entries.title: College student drops out, slams 'force-fed indoctrination': 'College industrial complex' is selling a big lie
entries.description: PragerU personality CJ Pearson said he left the University of Alabama with only three semesters remaining in order to help fight the "woke" agenda on campuses across America.

entries.title: Howard Stern makes bold prediction on McCarthy’s potential House speakership: GOP ‘kooks’ won’t give it to him
entries.description: Satellite radio host Howard Stern predicted that Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., will not become Speaker of the House thanks to "kooks" in his party.

entries.title: California looking to pay reparations to 600 people who were forcibly sterilized by the state
entries.description: California is looking to provide 600 people with $15,000 in reparations after the state sterilized people against their will as part of two different programs.

entries.title: Top House Democrat offers rare praise for conservative McCarthy opponent
entries.description: House Democratic Caucus vice chair Rep.-elect Ted Lieu offered rare praise for his Republican colleague, Chip Roy, who is one of 20 GOP lawmakers who voted against Kevin McCarthy to be speaker.

entries.title: Oregon suspect chews off elderly man’s ear, part of face in bloody train platform attack: police
entries.description: Koryn Kraemer, 25, was arrested in Gresham, Oregon, Tuesday after police say he was caught chewing off a 78-year-old man's ear and part of his face on a MAX train platform.

entries.title: One-of-a-kind Pontiac Grand Prix NASCAR-style coupe up for auction
entries.description: The only 1986 Pontiac Grand Prix 2+2 built in black will be crossing the auction block at the Mecum Auctions event in Kissimmee, Florida.

entries.title: Crocs called out for sponsoring drag show with children: 'This is not good for kids'
entries.description: "Fox Across America" host Jimmy Failla called the event disgusting and drew a comparison to the recent Balenciaga ad that featured children with teddy bears in bondage.

entries.title: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway looks back at ‘challenging year’ after giving up royal duties
entries.description: Princess Märtha Louise of Norway is a mother of three who is fourth in line to the Norwegian throne. She Is engaged to Durek Verrett, an American who describes himself as a shaman.

entries.title: Pete Buttigieg blasted for taking military aircraft to sporting event with husband: ‘Arrogant and detached’
entries.description: Twitter users slam Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg for using a military aircraft to travel with his husband to attend the Fifth Invictus Games in the Netherlands last spring

entries.title: Chip Roy, Jim Jordan spotted having intense discussion ahead of fourth House speaker vote
entries.description: House Freedom Caucus allies Jim Jordan of Ohio and Chip Roy of Texas were seen huddled moments before the House began its fourth vote to elect a new speaker.

entries.title: Joy Behar rips 'conservatives,' 'heterosexual men' for supporting tackle football: 'Just saying'
entries.description: "The View" co-host Joy Behar pointed to conservatives and heterosexual men as big proponents of youth football and tackle football during the show on Wednesday.

entries.title: Bills' Damar Hamlin has shown 'signs of improvement,' still in critical condition, team says
entries.description: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin was in critical condition but the team said he had "signs of improvement" on Tuesday and through the night.

entries.title: Avalanche buries University of Northern Colorado president, kills son amid dangerous backcountry conditions
entries.description: Andy Feinstein, president of University of Northern Colorado, survived an avalanche that killed his 22-year-old son, Nick, while the two were skiing on New Years Eve.

entries.title: Quadrantid meteor shower peaks as moon creates poor viewing conditions
entries.description: The Quadrantid meteor shower, the first and one of the best of the year, was peaking Wednesday morning amid a nearly full moon and stormy weather conditions.

entries.title: T.J. Holmes’s estranged wife slams his ‘lack of discretion, respect’ over Amy Robach cheating scandal
entries.description: T.J. Holmes’s estranged wife is “disappointed” by his lack of discretion with Amy Robach as the affair between the two ABC anchors continues to make headlines.

entries.title: Reporter calls out Biden for complaining of 'poison' politics while smearing Republicans as 'segregationists'
entries.description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre faced scrutiny after President Biden called for an end to "poison" politics despite smearing Republicans as racists in 2022.

entries.title: Start your year off by making sure all your devices are up to date
entries.description: Updating your most-up-to-date software on your devices can not only assure the proper function of your device, but the protection and privacy from malware as well.

entries.title: West Virginia University installs portable 'pod' for new parents nursing during football games
entries.description: West Virginia University installs a "pod" that parents can use who are nursing during football games. At the start of football season the pod moved to the north entrance of the stadium.

entries.title: Texas death row inmates allege state plans to use 'unsafe' execution drugs in lawsuit
entries.description: Texas death row inmates Robert Fratta, Wesley Ruiz and John Balentine are suing the state over plans to use expired, unsafe execution drugs, despite prison officials denying the claims.

entries.title: Ohio House lawmakers select Republican Rep. Jason Stephens as next leader
entries.description: Republican Rep. Jason Stephens has been selected as the next leader of the Ohio House. Republican lawmakers believe Stephens will bring needed stability.

entries.title: State Freedom Caucus Network expanding reach across US, as more states set up groups
entries.description: The State Freedom Caucus Network was set up at the end of 2021 and has expanded across more than a dozen states -- with more than three states joining on Wednesday.

entries.title: US Coast Guard recoveres 4 bodies from Gulf of Mexico helicopter crash
entries.description: The U.S. Coast Guard has recovered four bodies from a helicopter crash that occurred in the Gulf of Mexico. The helicopter was departing from an oil platform before the crash last week.

entries.title: Machete-wielding California man who held 12-year-old, attacked deputies is shot and killed
entries.description: Deputies in Riverside County, California, shot and killed a suspect who had barricaded himself in a home with his girlfriend's 12-year-old child and a machete.

entries.title: Lawyer for Brian Laundrie's parents opposes move by Gabby Petito's family to add attorney to civil lawsuit
entries.description: An attorney for the parents of Brian Laundrie has filed a court document in opposition of Gabby Petito's parents adding the Laundries' attorney, Steven Bertolino, to a civil lawsuit.

entries.title: Idaho murders: Daughter of BTK killer 'wouldn't be surprised' if suspect contacted her father
entries.description: Kerri Rawson, the daughter of infamous BTK serial killer Dennis Rader, shares concern about Idaho murder suspect Bryan Kohberger's potential ties to her father.

entries.title: Florida man arrested for temporarily blinding police helicopter pilot with laser: 'Mess around and find out'
entries.description: Florida police arrested a man for shining a laser into the cockpit of a police helicopter that temporarily blinded an officer and forced him to hand over the controls.

entries.title: Zelenskyy warns Russia will 'throw everything they have' in attempt to turn war around
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned in an overnight address that Russia is planning to ramp up its aggression and will "throw everything they have" in an attempt to turn the war around.

entries.title: Georgia man sends Masters invite back to PGA Tour golfer after mishap
entries.description: The Georgia man who received an invitation to participate in the Masters by mistake sent it back to the golfer who it was intended for.

entries.title: Biden has awkward exchange with reporter about not attending Pope Benedict's funeral
entries.description: President Biden was asked about why he won't be in attendance at Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's funeral during an awkward exchange with a reporter on Wednesday.

entries.title: House Dems say Republicans are in a state of 'chaos' as speaker battle continues
entries.description: House Democratic Caucus leadership on Wednesday called out Republicans for the "chaos and confusion" seen so far this week as they work to find a consensus House speaker candidate.

entries.title: BIDEN OR ABBOTT: Who’s handling the border crisis better? Americans decide
entries.description: Americans revealed who they believe has managed the border crisis better — President Biden or Gov. Greg Abbott — with a majority of people siding with the Texan.

entries.title: Video shows Historic Portland church engulfed in flames; crime unit investigating cause
entries.description: A three-alarm fire ravaged the historic Old Portland Korean Church now at risk of a major structural collapse, as the investigative unit probes for any potential criminal cause.

entries.title: UT ski resort worker dies after fallen tree shakes chairlift, ejecting the employee into a ravine
entries.description: A Utah ski resort employee died after being ejected from a chairlift. A nearby tree fell onto the lift cable which allowed the man to fall at least 25 feet and into a deep ravine.

entries.title: Pence joins Trump in backing McCarthy in House speaker race
entries.description: Former Vice-President Mike Pence spoke out Wednesday to address the ongoing civil war within the GOP regarding who will ascend to Speak of the House.

entries.title: House Freedom Caucus to nominate Byron Donalds for House speaker
entries.description: Fox News Digital has learned that the House Freedom Caucus will nominate Rep. Byron Donalds, R-Fla., as nominee for House speaker.

entries.title: Dem-turned-GOP congressman fires back at AOC's 'coalition government' proposal
entries.description: New Jersey Rep. Jeff Van Drew, a Republican who used to be a Democrat, fired back at Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's, D-N.Y., proposal for a "coalition government."

entries.title: Democratic Katie Hobbs sworn in as AZ’s 24th governor
entries.description: Katie Hobbs has officially become Arizona’s 24th governor. The Democrat won by a narrow margin against Republican Kari Lake, a former anchor backed by Donald Trump.

entries.title: Official portrait of Arkansas Gov. Hutchinson unveiled
entries.description: Republican Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson's official portrait was unveiled Tuesday, as the incumbent of eight years prepares to leave office and mulls a presidential bid.

entries.title: North Carolina to receive $110M for replacement bridge on US 64
entries.description: North Carolina will receive $110 million in funds to build a replacement bridge on U.S. 64. The state Department of Transportation applied for this grant last May.

entries.title: NHL Hall of Famer sends message in support of Damar Hamlin while recalling similar incident
entries.description: Former NHL star Chris Progner sent a message on social media in support of Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin while recalling the 1998 Stanley Cup playoff game when he collapsed on the ice.

entries.title: European Union's natural gas storage levels stand at nearly 84% despite Russian attempts to choke off supplies
entries.description: After stocking up on gas last year, the EU's natural gas storage levels stand at nearly 84%. This comes despite the fact that Russia has attempted to cut off natural gas supply.

entries.title: Tennessee National Guard rescues stranded Appalachian Trail hikers
entries.description: The Tennessee National Guard rescued two Appalachian Trail hikers who were stranded. The hikers couldn't escape on account of sheer cliffs and drop-offs.

entries.title: Real-life celeb couples who sizzle on-screen: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson, Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell and more
entries.description: Rita Wilson and Tom Hanks are among the movie couples who sizzle both on-screen and off-screen. The two will co-star in the upcoming film "Asteroid City," and worked together for "A Man Called Otto."

entries.title: George Soros' son becomes kingmaker with top Dems as he makes multiple Biden WH visits, meets with lawmakers
entries.description: Alex Soros, son of liberal billionaire George Soros, has quietly had a pipeline to President Biden's White House as he openly meets with other Democratic politicians.

entries.title: Times Square NYE celebration featured Chinese official who said Communist Party is 'great party'
entries.description: A Chinese government official who routinely praises the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) was featured at a New Year's Eve Times Square event attended by state and city officials.

entries.title: Bengals' Tee Higgins' family slams suggestion wide receiver was at fault for Damar Hamlin situation
entries.description: The family of Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver Tee Higgins slammed any notion that their son was to blame for what happened to Damar Hamlin.

entries.title: Florida couple murdered in retirement community identified, person of interest in custody: police
entries.description: Police in Florida have arrested a person of interest for allegedly murdering a married couple at their senior living community New Year's weekend. The woman has not been identified.

entries.title: GOP leader Kevin McCarthy claims 'progress' in House speaker vote, says game plan is 'to win'
entries.description: Republican leader Kevin McCarthy arrived on Capitol Hill Wednesday confident that he will win the election for speaker of the House after failing to do so three times Tuesday.

entries.title: Warner Bros and Graceland will screen 'Elvis' for free in 10 cities on the singer's birthday
entries.description: Graceland and Warner Bros. are working together to screen the blockbuster film "Elvis" for free in different cities across North America on Presley's Jan. 8 birthday.

entries.title: GOP congresswoman Anna Paulina Luna says she was 'sexually harassed' while leaving Capitol office
entries.description: Florida GOP Congresswoman-elect Anna Paulina Luna said Tuesday evening that says she was “sexually harassed” while leaving her office in the U.S. Capitol.

entries.title: Tennessee appoints Arizona official as new Correction commissioner
entries.description: Tennessee named the new Department of Correction commissioner as Arizona's Frank Strada. He is the deputy director for the Arizona Department of Corrections and will take over on Jan. 9.

entries.title: French police investigate allegations of sexual assault against former archbishop of Paris
entries.description: The archbishop of Paris has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman who is under legal protection. Authorities in France are investigating the allegations.

entries.title: Florence Pugh receives birthday message from ex-boyfriend Zach Braff
entries.description: Zach Braff took to Instagram to wish ex-girlfriend Florence Pugh a happy birthday. Florence first spoke about her split with Braff in September 2022.

entries.title: Alabama county declares state emergency regarding underground landfill fire
entries.description: An Alabama county declared a state of emergency over an underground landfill fire that has been burning since November. State or federal funds will be needed to address the fire.

entries.title: Virginia Gov. Youngkin vows to probe 'heinous cover-ups' at state schools: 'I'm not going away'
entries.description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin joined 'Tucker Carlson Tonight' Tuesday to break down two key school scandals that have riddled The Old Dominion State.

entries.title: MSNBC's Joy Reid calls the NFL a 'modern day gladiator spectacle' after Hamlin's heart attack
entries.description: MSNBC's Joy Reid compared professional football to gladiator combat on "The Reidout" Tuesday after Buffalo Bills player Damar Hamlin collapsed during a game.

entries.title: Cruz: House Speaker fight due to 'disappointing' election and because GOP doesn't 'follow orders' like Dems
entries.description: Republican Texas Sen. Ted Cruz said on his podcast that the ongoing House Speaker battle was due to the GOP's "disappointing" November election results.

entries.title: Texas man accused of kidnapping, viciously attacking and sexually assaulting Bumble date over 5 days
entries.description: Police in Houston, Texas, have arrested a man they say kidnapped and sexually abused a woman who refused his advances after the two met on a popular dating app.

entries.title: Nazi treasure map available to public, reveals possible location of gold, diamond trove
entries.description: News of "Nazi gold" in Poland and Iceland in recent years set off a frenzy for treasure hunters, but some fear that the Dutch trove may have already been found and cleared.

entries.title: Washington substation attacks alleged motive revealed
entries.description: The FBI says one of the two men charged in all four substation attacks in Washington state on Christmas Day claimed their motive was to disrupt power to burglarize a business.

entries.title: Kelly Osbourne welcomes first baby with Sid Wilson, Sharon Osbourne praises daughter: 'So proud'
entries.description: Sharon Osbourne announced that she is now the grandmother to five children, as her daughter Kelly has given birth to her first child, a boy named Sidney.

entries.title: Miami 'Pride' police cruiser mocked after going viral on Twitter: 'Society is unsalvageable’
entries.description: Conservatives on Twitter blasted a viral clip of a Miami Police Department police vehicle that sported a rainbow theme and was designed in honor of Pride month.

entries.title: Adam Schiff dragged after ‘Twitter Files’ shows he asked site to suspend journo: ‘Expel Schiff from Congress'
entries.description: Twitter users erupted on the platform Tuesday after the latest "Twitter Files" thread alleged that Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., requested Twitter to suspend journalists.

entries.title: Gianno Caldwell reveals to Tucker Carlson what inspired him to get involved in Chicago politics
entries.description: Fox News political analyst Gianno Caldwell told Tucker Carlson during a Fox Nation special how his childhood in Chicago shaped his interest in politics.

entries.title: California arsonists set themselves on fire while attacking business, video shows
entries.description: A video captured in Bakersfield, California shows two suspected arsonists setting themselves on fire while attacking a business early Monday.

entries.title: GOP senators urge House to move past 'family fight' over speaker election as McCarthy support still uncertain
entries.description: Republican senators are urging the House to move past its speakership election drama, calling it a "family fight" that must be resolved quickly.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin's family reportedly provides update on Bills player's health
entries.description: A family friend of Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin provided a small update on the player as he continues to be in the ICU at a Cincinnati hospital.

entries.title: Florida Sen. Rick Scott urges Senate Republicans 'to be bold... stop caving in,’ in new nationwide ad blitz
entries.description: Republican Sen. Rick Scott of Florida is taking his message to “change” the GOP nationwide, as he launches a new ad explaining his unsuccessful challenge to Senate GOP Leader McConnell

entries.title: Biden breaks silence on House speakership fight, urges Republicans to 'get their act together'
entries.description: President Biden finally weighed in on the undecided House speaker's race, calling it "embarrassing" that Republicans have not united around a leader.

entries.title: Cavs treated to PED tests following Donovan Mitchell’s 71-point outburst: report
entries.description: The NBA administered tests for performance-enhancing drugs to the Cleveland Cavaliers one day after Donovan Mitchell scored 71-points against the Chicago Bulls.

entries.title: Bryan Kohberger is on his way to Idaho to face murder charges
entries.description: Bryan Kohberger is on his way to Idaho to face first-degree murder charges for allegedly stabbing to death four college students, a source told Fox News.

entries.title: Byron Donalds defends voting against McCarthy for speaker: 'I want a resolution'
entries.description: Rep. Byron Donalds defended his decision to flip his vote for House speaker away from Kevin McCarthy in the third round of voting on Tuesday.

entries.title: San Francisco braces for potentially life-threatening bomb cyclone that could bring flooding, winds, mudslides
entries.description: An approaching atmospheric river is threatening to bring widespread flooding, whipping winds and heavy rains and snowfall to northern California this week.

entries.title: First openly transgender person executed in US requested classic meal before death
entries.description: Amber McLaughlin, a Missouri inmate believed to be the first openly transgender person executed in U.S. history, requested a classic last meal before being put to death.

entries.title: Elle King recounts scary fall that left her with amnesia and a concussion: 'The baby is totally fine'
entries.description: Elle King explained the details behind her fall last month that resulted in her canceling concerts in three cities. The musician also discussed what she is doing to recover.

entries.title: ND Gov. Burgum highlights state energy sector in annual address
entries.description: Republican North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum's State of the State address on Tuesday touted the success of the state's energy sector and discussed plans to foster economic growth.

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI and Pope John Paul II: Catholicism's dynamic duo
entries.description: It should come as no surprise that Popes Benedict XVI and John Paul II were of one mind on most issues.

entries.title: Question about an 'obvious sign' someone’s American goes viral: 'You hear them coming like thunder'
entries.description: A Reddit user asks followers to share an "obvious sign someone's American," reinforcing some stereotypes and provided several, fun travel anecdotes.

entries.title: Suspected homegrown terrorist Trevor Bickford to appear in court virtually on NYE slashing charges
entries.description: Trevor Bickford will make his first virtual appearance in court Wednesday for allegedly slashing two New York police officers on New Year's Eve.

entries.title: Western Michigan reports third potential celebratory gunfire death on New Year's Day
entries.description: A third western Michigan death allegedly caused by celebratory gunfire has occurred in Grand Rapids, with a similar incident that killed two men previously being reported.

entries.title: Japan offering families 1 million yen per child to leave Tokyo for rural areas
entries.description: Japanese lawmakers have boosted an incentive program that will now provide 1 million yen, $7,500, per child to families who leave Tokyo for rural areas.

entries.title: Buffalo house fire kills 5 children, injures grandmother
entries.description: A house fire in Buffalo killed five children and hospitalized the children's grandmother. The grandmother remains in critical condition in a local burn unit.

entries.title: Pope Benedict's secretary soon to publish inside story of his papacy, 'Nothing but the Truth'
entries.description: Archbishop Georg Gänswein, prefect of the papal household and personal secretary to Pope Benedict XVI, will be publishing an inside account of the late pontiff's time at the Vatican.

entries.title: Washington, DC, shooting leaves 1 dead, 3 injured including 8-year-old child
entries.description: A Washington, D.C., shooting leaves one dead, three injured including an eight-year-old child on Tuesday. The police searched for at least three suspects after the shooting.

entries.title: Matt Gaetz responds after Trump urges support for McCarthy: 'Sad!'
entries.description: Florida Republican Rep. Matt Gaetz went rogue from his mentor, former President Trump, after the former president endorsed GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy of California for House speaker.

entries.title: Newt Gingrich hammers GOP 'blackmailers' opposing Kevin McCarthy: 'Don't know what their endgame is'
entries.description: Newt Gingrich, former speaker of the House, explained that the Republicans refusing to support Kevin McCarthy are preventing the party from moving its agenda forward.

entries.title: New Hampshire mayors request federal funds to help assist the homeless
entries.description: Mayors across New Hampshire have written to Gov. Chris Sununu requesting federal funds to help the homeless. The state has programs already in place to assist the homeless.

entries.title: SD Gov. Noem taps Mitchell superintendent for top education post
entries.description: Republican South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem announced Tuesday that she has appointed Mitchell School District Superintendent Jon Graves to head the state's Department of Education.

entries.title: 1 dead, 1 wounded in Indiana mall shooting
entries.description: A juvenile male and a man were shot outside an Indianapolis mall Tuesday night. The juvenile is reported dead, the man injured, and the suspect remaining cooperative.

entries.title: Why was Trevor Bauer suspended from MLB? Here's what happened when Dodger pitcher appealed the ruling
entries.description: In April 2022, Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer received the longest non-lifetime suspension ever issued in the history of the MLB.

entries.title: Florida Keys overwhelmed by boatloads of migrants: 'A mass migration crisis'
entries.description: Monroe County, Florida sheriff joins "Fox & Friends" to discuss boats of migrants arriving to the Florida Keys and how this has overwhelmed local officials.

entries.title: 17-year-old wielding knife fatally shot by New Hampshire police officer
entries.description: The New Hampshire attorney general's office announced that a 17-year-old was fatally shot by a police officer. The teen died of a single gunshot wound.

entries.title: Aaron Rodgers on Bills' Damar Hamlin's incident: 'It f---ed me up'
entries.description: Green Bay Packers star Aaron Rodgers explained his reaction to the medical emergency Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin suffered on Monday night.

entries.title: Biden re-nominates embattled former LA mayor Eric Garcetti despite sexual harassment scandal
entries.description: Former Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti was re-nominated by President Biden despite allegations that the long-time California democrat was an "enabler" of sexual harassment during his time in office.

entries.title: Ex-Waffle House employee recalls fighting 'extremely drunk' customer in viral brawl: 'Adrenaline and instinct'
entries.description: Former Waffle House employee Halie Booth details how she defended herself in a fight against an 'intoxicated' customer at the restaurant chain after becoming viral sensation.

entries.title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams slams handling of migrant crisis as 'a real embarrassment' on a national level
entries.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said Tuesday during an appearance on "Sid and Friends in the Morning" that the migrant crisis in the U.S. was a "real embarrassment."

entries.title: Two things Republicans must do in 2023 to win in 2024
entries.description: If Republicans want to avoid a Democrat sweep of the House, Senate, and the White House in 2024, they need to become the expert political strategists in 2023.

entries.title: Putin deploys frigate to Atlantic Ocean armed with hypersonic Zircon cruise missiles
entries.description: A Russian ship called the Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, which is armed with hypersonic cruise missiles, has deployed to the Atlantic Ocean Wednesday.

entries.title: Russia blames banned cellphone use for New Year's Day strike on military barracks as death toll climbs
entries.description: Russia appeared to blame its own troops for the deadly strike on military barracks in Makiyivka on New Years Day, saying banned cellphone used alerted Ukrainian troops to the barrack's location.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin incident could be a 'wake-up call' about how violent football is, ex-NFL star says
entries.description: The medical emergency Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin experienced may have a lasting effect on players, former NFL star Shawne Merriam suggested on Tuesday.

entries.title: Google Chrome's 'incognito' mode might not keep you so hidden
entries.description: Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson explains how using incognito mode may not be the most private way to browse the internet and shows you how to keep your browse history safe.

entries.title: Twitter freaks out over AOC chatting with GOP lawmaker during Speaker vote: Wasn't on my 2023 'bingo card'
entries.description: A conversation between Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y. and Rep. Paul Gosar, R-Ariz., during the House speakership vote sent online observers into a frenzy.

entries.title: GOP rebels throw McCarthy's speakership into question, Buttigieg's ritzy ride and more top headlines
entries.description: GOP rebels throw McCarthy's speakership into question, Buttigieg's ritzy ride and more top headlines

entries.title: 'Boy Meets World's' Matthew Lawrence, Chilli from TLC dating: 'She is glowing'
entries.description: Following his divorce from former "Dancing with the Stars" pro Cheryl Burke, "Boy Meets Word" star Matthew Lawrence is dating "Chilli" from TLC, according to a rep for the singer.

entries.title: NFL legend Michael Irvin on Damar Hamlin: 'You may lose a limb, but you never thought you would lose a life'
entries.description: NFL great Michael Irvin talked about the Damar Hamlin medical emergency on Tuesday in a radio interview and offered his own perspective on the ordeal.

entries.title: Ex-WWE star makes return to pro wrestling for new company under different ring name
entries.description: Mercedes Moné made her debut in New Japan Pro Wrestling at Wrestle Kingdom 17 on Wednesday after her run as Sasha Banks in WWE came to an official end.

entries.title: Rep-elects erroneously share press releases saying they were sworn in hours after failed House Speaker votes
entries.description: Rep-elect George Santos, among others, erroneously claimed they were sworn into Congress on Tuesday, despite the House of Representatives not holding such ceremonies.

entries.title: Parenting column offers advice on not 'raising racist children': Learn history through 'the prism of racism'
entries.description: An education website offered a bit of parenting advice for how to raise children right in a recent column on “racist kids" and "well-meaning white parents."

entries.title: Parenting column offers advise on not 'raising racist children': Learn history through 'the prism of racism'
entries.description: An education website offered a bit of parenting advice for how to raise children right in a recent column on “racist kids" and "well-meaning white parents."

entries.title: Donald Trump's first abortion mistake
entries.description: Donald Trump added pro-life Americans to those whom he blames for tripping him on his newly engaged run for the White House.

entries.title: Connecticut man allegedly killed 2-year-old son, buried body in plastic bag at park
entries.description: A Connecticut man allegedly killed his two-year-old son before burying the remains in a plastic bag at a park. He is also accused of holding the child's mother at gunpoint.

entries.title: Texas rejects more than 5,000 personalized plates in 2022: 'LA KILLA,' 'SHE MAD' among thousands
entries.description: Over 5,000 personalized license plates were denied by the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles between January and October 2022, including 'LA KILLA,' '2@BADASH' and 'MR.CRAZY.'

entries.title: Republican attorneys general ditch association over alleged liberal bias, financial questions
entries.description: The National Association of Attorneys General has lost millions of dollars since Republican AGs began leaving the group over financial, ideological concerns.

entries.title: Social media praises ESPN's Dan Orlovsky's on-air prayer for Damar Hamlin: 'Powerful, brave and genuine'
entries.description: ESPN football analyst Dan Orlovsky led an impromptu prayer on behalf of Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin during a live appearance on Tuesday's "NFL Live."

entries.title: TikTok's 'diet culture' reveals feelings of 'weight bias and fat phobia' according to study
entries.description: A study concludes that TikTok content that promotes 'personal responsibility for meeting weight expectations,' perpetuates diet culture that glorifies thinness and weight loss among teens and young adults

entries.title: McCarthy opponents cause House chaos but raise valuable objections – Republican Party needs a reboot
entries.description: On Tuesday, would-be California Republican Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed to get enough votes to become Speaker of the House. He lost on not one, not two but three votes.

entries.title: Lauren Boebert speaks out on not supporting Kevin McCarthy for House speaker
entries.description: Rep.-elect Lauren Boebert, R-Colo., shares why she didn't vote for Kevin McCarthy to become House Speaker and who she will support on 'Special Report.'

entries.title: Youngkin calls on Virginia AG to investigate high school that withheld merit-based awards
entries.description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin is calling for an investigation into a high school that delayed informing students of their merit awards in the name of equity.

entries.title: Dave & Buster’s co-founder James ‘Buster’ Corley dead at 72
entries.description: One of the co-founders of the popular restaurant-arcade chain Dave & Buster’s, James “Buster” Corley, was found dead in his Texas home on Monday, the company announced.

entries.title: Washington teacher who brought MAGA hat to school trainings protected under First Amendment, court rules
entries.description: The 9th Circuit Court of Appeals ruled a former Washington teacher's decision to bring a MAGA hat to a school training on two separate occasions was protected under the First Amendment.

entries.title: As McCarthy falls short on speakership, can anyone govern the House GOP?
entries.description: When they took control yesterday, rather than addressing the country’s problems, the GOP presented a portrait of dysfunction, squabbling over personal grievances.

entries.title: National Spaghetti Day: A look at the history of the dish
entries.description: Here’s what you need to know about spaghetti on National Spaghetti Day, which falls on Jan.4. Spaghetti is known as an Italian dish that is often served with sauce and meatballs.

entries.title: Disney’s ABC News plagued by death, scandals and public relations nightmares
entries.description: Disney's once-vaunted ABC News has been rocked by tragic deaths and a series of public relations nightmares in recent weeks, with an extramarital affair dominating tabloids.

entries.title: Jeremy Renner's snow-plow accident: What to know about the Hollywood actor
entries.description: Jeremy Renner remains in critical but stable condition following a snow-plow accident on Jan. 1.

entries.title: It's been a year since we left New York for Florida. Here's what we learned
entries.description: One year ago I boarded a plane with my husband and three kids and left New York City for Florida. I love New York and it was very hard to leave. Here's what it's been like.

entries.title: Baby's outraged mom takes to TikTok after toy spews crude jokes in place of songs and sounds
entries.description: A mom took to social media platform TikTok to vent her anger over a toy given to her baby by a family member. The toy's audio contained lewd jokes instead of age-appropriate songs and sounds.

entries.title: Pete Buttigieg brought husband Chasten on military aircraft to attend sporting event in Netherlands
entries.description: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and his husband traveled as part of a presidential delegation to the Invictus Games in the Netherlands last year in a military aircraft.

entries.title: McCarthy, GOP hope to break House speaker logjam after whiffing on Tuesday
entries.description: Republican debates over House Majority Speaker Kevin McCarthy led to three failed votes for speaker on Tuesday and marked the first failed vote since 1923.

entries.title: In the face of crime and danger, Americans stepped up to help complete strangers in 2022: 'People are amazing'
entries.description: Fox News Digital compiled five instances in 2022 when good Samaritans stepped in to protect or save a stranger from dangerous situations, including robberies and physical attacks.

entries.title: 'Romeo & Juliet' stars sue for more than $500M over 1968 film's teen nude scene
entries.description: The two stars of 1968's “Romeo and Juliet” filed a lawsuit against Paramount Pictures saying they suffered damages due to the film's sex scene, which was recorded when they were teens.

entries.title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Where We Stand Tonight in the Speaker’s Race
entries.description: Rep. Kevin McCarthy was unable to secure the 218 House votes needed to become Speaker during Tuesday's vote, and some Republicans may be absent for another vote.

entries.title: Colorado woman killed in hit-and-run crash after rideshare driver kicks her out for being 'ill'
entries.description: A Colorado woman was killed in a hit-and-run crash on an interstate on New Year's Day after her rideshare driver made her get out for allegedly becoming ill.

entries.title: California man intentionally drove Tesla off cliff with another adult, 2 kids in car: authorities
entries.description: A California man is facing attempted murder and child abuse charges after authorities said he intentionally drove himself and three others off 'Devil's Slide' cliff in a Tesla.

entries.title: GREG GUTFELD: The nuts are being seen for what they truly are
entries.description: Greg Gutfeld discusses everything that went wrong in the past year and how he is still positive things can be fixed on "Gutfeld!"

entries.title: GREG GUTFLED: The nuts are being seen for what they truly are
entries.description: Greg Gutfeld discusses everything that went wrong in the past year and how he is still positive things can be fixed on "Gutfeld!"

entries.title: Sean Hannity: Republicans need to heed Ronald Reagan's advice amid speakership fight
entries.description: Fox News host Sean Hannity breaks down the fight over the speaker vote in Tuesday's opening monologue on 'Hannity.'

entries.title: On this day in history, Jan. 4, 1965, LBJ touts utopian 'Great Society' in State of the Union address
entries.description: President Lyndon B. Johnson touted a "Great Society" in his State of the Union address of Jan. 4, 1965, proposing the federal government as the solution to human ills.

entries.title: Matt Gaetz challenges Kevin McCarthy's use of House Speaker Office after failed election votes
entries.description: Rep. Matt Gaetz has asked the Architect of the Capitol for clarity on why Kevin McCarthy gets to work out of the House Speaker's Office despite not being elected to the position.

entries.title: LAURA INGRAHAM: 'Millions' were comforted by prayer after tragic NFL injury
entries.description: Laura Ingraham discusses how the prayer united people after Buffalo Bills player Damar Hamlin was injured during a game on "The Ingraham Angle."

entries.title: Parents of Idaho murder victim speak out after arrest of Kohberger: 'We feel lucky knowing we have somebody'
entries.description: Kaylee Goncalves' parents, Steve and Kristi, react to the arrest of alleged murderer Bryan Christopher Kohberger and share what outcome they would like to see during the trial on 'Hannity.'

entries.title: Bills' Dion Dawkins hopes Damar Hamlin's tragic incident shows NFL fans 'we are vulnerable humans'
entries.description: As Dion Dawkins and his Buffalo Bills teammates continue to pray for safety Damar Hamlin, the tackle hopes fans can recognize that these athletes are humans, too.

entries.title: TUCKER CARLSON: How badly does Kevin McCarthy want to be House speaker?
entries.description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson gives his take on Rep. Kevin McCarthy's struggle to secure the House speaker position and reveals why he will need to make concessions on "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

entries.title: Incoming California congressman to be sworn in on Superman comic
entries.description: Incoming U.S. Rep. Robert Garcia on Tuesday said he will take his oath of office, not on a Bible, but on a rare "Superman" comic book.

entries.title: Florida alleged burglars call 911 for help 'moving their belongings,' get caught by owners: sheriff
entries.description: Florida law enforcement officials arrested two people after they called 911 to ask for assistance in "moving their belongings" from a house they were allegedly burglarizing.

entries.title: Childcare woes continue as many return to normal after pandemic amid staffing shortages, illnesses
entries.description: Childcare facilities across the United States continue to feel burden of COVID despite many industries starting to return to normal.

entries.title: New York Times mocked for essay on short people being better for the planet: 'Ridiculous'
entries.description: 'The Five' co-hosts react to a guest essay for the New York Times insisting that being short is "better" for the future. New York Times guest essay argues 'short people' better for the planet

entries.title: FDA to permit some retail pharmacies to dispense abortion pills
entries.description: On Tuesday, the FDA officially removed the in-person requirement from its regulatory rule book for abortion pill. Now, women will be able to access the abortion pill in retail pharmacies across the U.S.

entries.title: Bills legend Andre Reed knows 'resilient' Buffalo community will rally for Damar Hamlin
entries.description: Buffalo Bills great and NFL Hall of Famer Andre Reed is shocked at what transpired with safety Damar Hamlin Monday. He knows Buffalo will have his back.

entries.title: White House press secretary skirts question on House investigating Hunter Biden's business deals
entries.description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre deflected a question from a reporter on Tuesday asking if President Biden lied about his involvement in family business schemes.

entries.title: Idaho murders: Judge issues gag order blocking officials, defense from discussing case against Bryan Kohberger
entries.description: Idaho Judge Megan Marshall has issued a gag order in the ambush murders of four University of Idaho students who were killed in their sleep in November.

entries.title: JESSE WATTERS: 'Mini-Madoff' took millions in 'rat poison' and fed it to Joe Biden
entries.description: Fox News host Jesse Watters breaks down a Netflix documentary detailing the Bernie Madoff scheme and compares it to FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's scandal on 'Jesse Watters Primetime.'

entries.title: Conservatives celebrate law that ensures age verification to view online porn: 'Big win from Louisiana'
entries.description: Conservatives largely celebrated the news on Twitter that Louisiana had successfully passed a law to require ID verification for most porn sites in the state.

entries.title: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson, Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell, and more real-life celeb couples who sizzle on screen
entries.description: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson are one of Hollywood's most enduring on and off-screen couples

entries.title: Bills' Damar Hamlin showing signs of improvement, uncle says
entries.description: Damar Hamlin's uncle told NFL Network on Tuesday night that his nephew is still on a ventilator, but has shown improvements since collapsing Monday night.

entries.title: Frank Galati, Tony Award-winning director and actor, dead at 79
entries.description: Frank Galati, a huge influence in the Chicago theater community and two-time Tony Award winner for his adaptation of "The Grapes of Wrath," died Monday.

entries.title: Nevada school district sued for ‘pornographic’ assignment that was barred from being read to school board
entries.description: A Nevada school district is being sued by two parents who allege that their child was forced to read a 'pornographic’ monologue in class.

entries.title: State Department calls on China to be more transparent on current COVID-19 surge, virus' origins
entries.description: State Department spokesperson Ned Price called on China to be more transparent about the current COVID-19 outbreak and origins of the virus on Tuesday.

entries.title: Missouri executes transgender woman for 2003 murder of girlfriend
entries.description: Missouri executed a transgender woman for the murder of her former girlfriend.

entries.title: 2024 speculation grows after DeSantis speech: 'Sure sounds a lot like the launch of a Presidential campaign'
entries.description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis was praised by conservatives on Twitter for his inauguration speech Tuesday with some speculating it sounded like a presidential campaign speech.

entries.title: Farmers slam Biden over latest eco regulation targeting businesses: 'Federal overreach'
entries.description: American farm and agriculture groups blasted an environmental regulation issued by the Biden administration which increases scrutiny on how water sources are protected.

entries.title: Walter Cunningham, last surviving NASA Apollo 7 astronaut, dies at 90: 'true hero'
entries.description: Walter Cunningham, the last surviving astronaut from the first successful crewed space mission in NASA's Apollo program, died Tuesday.

entries.title: Republicans torched for McCarthy-House speaker vote fiasco: 'Worst game of chicken ever'
entries.description: 'The Five' co-hosts weigh in after Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., failed a third time to reach the 218 vote majority necessary to become House Speaker.

entries.title: Pelicans lose Zion Williamson at least three weeks to hamstring injury
entries.description: The New Orleans Pelicans have lost star forward Zion Williamson at least three weeks after an MRI Tuesday showed a hamstring strain he suffered Monday night.

entries.title: Apple AirTag leads Michigan police to stolen car, suspect opens fire on officer
entries.description: An undercover Dearborn, Michigan police officer was shot at while working to recover a stolen car in Detroit on Monday that he tracked via Apple Airtags.

entries.title: ESPN analyst prays for Bills' Damar Hamlin during live broadcast
entries.description: ESPN's Dan Orlovsky took a minute during Tuesday's "NFL Live" to pray for Damar Hamlin of the Buffalo Bills, who went into cardiac arrest during Monday Night Football.

entries.title: White House press secretary blames GOP, claims President Biden worked on border security since 'day one'
entries.description: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre, pressed by reporter on border security, said Biden has worked on it since day one and Republicans are "doing political stunts."
